paper_metadata.title: Effect of Participation in Ecological Public Welfare Positions on Farmers' Household Income Composition: Evidence from China

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: PEPWP significantly increased farmers' planting income in Jiangxi Province, husbandry income in Hubei Province, and wage income in both provinces

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: Results showed that (1) PEPWP was characterized by 'self-selection', which significantly increased farmers' wage level, planting income in Jiangxi Province, and husbandry income in Hubei Province
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: This study explored the effect of participation in ecological public welfare positions (PEPWP) on farmers' household income composition and clarified the internal mechanism by propensity score matching (PSM)

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: The ecological public welfare positions policy, which involves low-income people in ecological conservation work
evidence_citations.country_citation: based on the field data from 508 formerly registered impoverished households in Jiangxi Province and Hubei Province, China
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: The ecological public welfare positions policy, which involves low-income people in ecological conservation work
